head.title: COPY MACHINE MAKER IS RAISING PRICES

hedline.hl1: COPY MACHINE MAKER IS RAISING PRICES

block.p: The Xerox Corporation said yesterday that it would raise prices on document processing products by 2 percent to 7 percent to most commercial customers in the United States as of Feb. 1. Increases for contract and government customers will take effect at the beginning of the next contract period. For convenience and work-group copiers, prices will rise 5 to 7 percent, Xerox said. Most departmental copiers will go up 2 to 5 percent. On Wednesday, Xerox said it lost more than $1 billion in the fourth quarter and $472 million for the year after writing off the costs of selling its insurance businesses.
